Biography: Kathryn Shahwan, MD, is a MOHS micrographic surgery expert at the Ohio State Wexner Medical Center, specializing in skin cancer treatment and advanced reconstructive techniques.
Education & Training: The Ohio State University (2021); Massachusetts General Hospital/Harvard Medical School (2016); University of Minnesota Medical School (2020); Loyola University Medical Center (2015); Chicago Medical School at Rosalind Franklin U-Med & Sciences (Graduated 2014); UNIVERSITY OF SAINT THOMAS (Graduated 2010)
Locations: 6700 University Blvd
Sample Review:
"I had an amazing experience with Dr. Shahwan. She is really professional and explains to you every single detail. I’ll definitely be going back to her since she is the best in the area!"
"Dr. Shahwan is so professional and experienced I felt very much at ease from the get go. She explained everything and was at hand for any questions and concerns after the procedure. I am so happy with the overall result. Thanks again Dr. Shahwan"
"I will not allow anyone else to remove my skin cancer - she knows exactly what she is doing, she has an eye for detail and is extremely knowledgeable"
"She was gentle and made sure I was comfortable the whole time. If you’re looking for a dermatologist you MUST check out this practice!"
"My daughter has been going to Dr. Shahwan for a number of months to treat kieloids. She did an awesome job. She and her staff are great."
"I have had several Mohs surgeries for basal cell skin cancers performed by Dr. Shahwan. She does a wonderful job. The staff has always been great too."
"Dr. Kathryn explained everything she was doing and why she was doing it a certain way. She was constantly teaching in a friendly way. She answered all my questions. This was my second surgery with her and I highly recommend the doctor."
"Dr. Shahwan and her staff are excellent. This was the best. They provide a relaxing, friendly and professional atmosphere for skin cancer surgery. "
"Dr. Kathryn performed Mohs surgery on my forehead last week and I could write volumes regarding the care I received!"
"Dr. Kathryn Shahwan is outstanding both in regards to her medical abilities and her personal touch with patients. "
" Highly recommended to anyone wanting an excellent experience with predictable results."
"Very pleasant, professional, efficient visit; She explained everything she was doing in an easy to understand way."
"I recently had a MOH procedure. Dr. Kathryn Shahwan was extremely professional, caring and gracious. Her facilities are beautiful and state of the art. I am very thankful!"
"She is very honest and pleasant. I highly recommend her to anyone who is looking for a good dermatologist."
"Brilliant, caring, knowledgeable, kind. Dr Shahwan has helped my wife and me in countless ways, getting rid of unwanted skin tags, fixing mistakes that other doctors made, curing painful issues that nobody else could even diagnose, and just keeping us healthy."
"Doctor Kathryn Shahwan is the best! I felt very welcomed, and she promptly took care of my procedure. I encourage everyone to book an appointment for any skin issue."
"Had a great experience today with Dr. Shahwan. She is top notch and her nurses as well. Very minimal cutting and left a barely noticeable scar, I definitely recommend her to everyone. Thank you, Doc!"
"I am so thankful that I was able to get in to see Dr. Shahwan. She did not rush my appointment and kindly addressed all of my concerns. Her staff was very helpful and welcoming. "
"I've had multiple appointments with Dr. Shahwan. She is highly skilled in her field. Highly recommended!"
"I had a surgical procedure with Dr. Katie Shahwan yesterday. Her office staff was very friendly and easy to schedule with and answered all my questions. Dr. Shahwan was personable, professional, and quick. It was a positive experience when it could have been a nightmare!"

Sample Review: "I was there yesterday. A biopsy was done on a spot on my leg. A bandaid was put on over biopsy area. I was sent on my my way and told to enjoy my day. Thankfully all I did was head home. I thought I could feel dampness on my pant leg. When we got out at Smyrna I decided to check. Blood was running down my leg and soaking into my pants. Thankfully I did not have other activities planned after the visit. I called your office and never received a call back. In Smyrna I replaced bandaid with two bandaids. Which soaked through immediately. I kept pressure on it on my way to Houlton ER. The bleeding was almost stopped by the time I was seen. They put a pressure bandage on it. Thankfully I knew to put pressure on it as I was driving. I also tried calling this morning and left messages since you can’t get through to a human and have not yet received a call back. J Votaw 227-8516"

Biography: Dr. Iyer diagnoses and treats of all types of skin conditions including medical, surgical, skin oncology and cosmetic dermatology. She has special interests in prevention, detection and management of skin cancers including those who are immune suppressed and at an incre Dr. Iyer believes in holistic and sustained quality care of her patients based on a foundation of trust and communication.
Locations: 9924 NE 185th St
Sample Review:
"I have several doctors that help me with my health concerns. I saw Dr Iyer yesterday for the first time. I read all the reviews so I was a little apprehensive prior to meeting her. I was extremely impressed not only with her knowledge but with the genuine care she showed me as a person. She took her time to address each of my concerns and made sure I understood what I needed to do. I left with respect and appreciation for Dr Iyer."
"If you want a doctor that is very detailed and straight forward this is your doctor. Being a retired Army officer she takes control of your situation and uses a very aggressive style of treatment. Personally, I find people that are blunt and honest very refreshing. No sugar coating. Be honest to yourself. You want a doctor that gives you the best treatment"
"She can be brusque and doesn't always pay attention. She takes her time replying to online messages and doesn't always read them thoroughly. She's adequate, but I don't know if I fully trust her."
"I was scheduled 3 months out to see Dr Iyer and was called the day of my appointment being told Dr Iyer called out 2 days in a row. Instead of taking care of the patients on off days or moving things around, the people that had been waiting months had to schedule 3-4 months later. I shouldn’t have to wait longer than someone who made their appointment way later than mine."
"I don’t understand all the negative reviews. I found Dr. Iyer to be very kind and compassionate. She listened to my concerns and explained everything. I feel she’s very well informed. I am a retired RN"
"I cannot understand which clinic has 15 mins appointment! I reached a few mins late as this was my first time visiting and the receptionist canceled on me after I reached saying appointments are just 15 mins long. Really disappointed!"
"Had a negative experience with this doctor. She is not flexible and is not taking proper care of her patients. Don‘t recommend her"
"1. I asked her what behaviors I might try modifying such as types of foods to avoid, light exposure, sleep, etc... But she ignored my questions and did not engage in conversation with me. She clearly saw me as a checkbox and not a human. 2. She just prescribed medication for symptoms without discussing root cause. 3. She was overly concerned with a blood blister on the bottom of my foot (I walk/run barefoot a lot)--insisting that she take pictures of it. Seems like a typical book-smart doctor that has never had a blood blister before. Come on. Even I know that's irrelevant. Summary: We need better doctors who are willing to collaborate with their patients, find root causes rather than treating symptoms, and who have contact with reality/experience in the real world so that they know what is worth paying attention to."
"I went in to get a skin check for cancer, see about getting some moles/skin tags removed, and if there was anything that could be done about some rashy skin. She was very short with me and didn't answer my questions. She seemed more concerned with a bump on my forehead I thought was just a zit. She never told me it with it was. Frankly I wouldn't go back if it wasn't for I'd have to start over with another dermatologist."
